keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled that gays and lesbians have the right to marry in all Alabama counties, but stayed enforcement of her decision until the Supreme Court issues a ruling on same-sex marriage.

headline.print_headline: South; Alabama: Marriage Ban Is Struck Down Again
headline.main: Alabama: Marriage Ban Is Struck Down Again

snippet: A federal judge ruled that gays and lesbians have the right to marry in all Alabama counties, but stayed enforcement of her decision until the Supreme Court issues a ruling on same-sex marriage.
abstract: Federal Judge Callie V S Granade rules gays and lesbians have the right to marry in all counties in Alabama, saying state's ban on same-sex marriage is unconstitutional; stays enforcement of decision until United States Supreme Court issues ruling on issue.
